javadoc:
Class for maintaining information about a table's column for the purpose of configuring filters
 based on that columns values.  These are generated by examining a table's column types and finding
 out if there are any ColumnConstraints that support that type.  If so, a ColumnFilterData is
 created for that column which then allows filtering on that columns data.
@param <T> the column type.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Constructs a new ColumnFilterData for a table column

params.name: columnModelIndex
params.comment: the model index of the column

params.name: columnViewIndex
params.comment: the view index of the column

methods.name: setViewIndex
methods.comment:
Sets the viewIndex

 This needs to be updated whenever columns are added, deleted, or moved.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the view index of the column
@return the view index of the column.
methods.name: getViewIndex
methods.comment: Returns the view index of the column

return.comment: the view index of the column.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if the column represented by this data has applicable column filters.
@return true if the column represented by this data has applicable column filters.
methods.name: isFilterable
methods.comment: Returns true if the column represented by this data has applicable column filters.

return.comment: true if the column represented by this data has applicable column filters.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the list of applicable constraints for this column
@return the list of applicable constraints for this column
methods.name: getConstraints
methods.comment: Returns the list of applicable constraints for this column

return.comment: the list of applicable constraints for this column

methods.javadoc:
Returns the name of the column represented by this ColumnFilterData
@return the name of the column represented by this ColumnFilterData
methods.name: getName
methods.comment: Returns the name of the column represented by this ColumnFilterData

return.comment: the name of the column represented by this ColumnFilterData

methods.name: getConstraint
methods.comment: Returns the ColumnConstraint with the given name

params.name: constraintName
params.comment: the name of the constraint to retrieve

return.comment: the ColumnConstraint with the given name.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the model index for the column represented by this class.
@return the model index for the column represented by this class.
methods.name: getColumnModelIndex
methods.comment: Returns the model index for the column represented by this class.

return.comment: the model index for the column represented by this class.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the first constraint in the list.
@return the constraint
methods.name: getFirstConstraint
methods.comment: Returns the first constraint in the list.

methods.name: replace
methods.comment:
Replace the same named constraint with the given constraint.  This allows the
 column constraint to remember the last used value.

params.name: value
params.comment: the constraint to be used to replace the existing one with the same name.

name: ColumnFilterData
comment:
Class for maintaining information about a table's column for the purpose of configuring filters
 based on that columns values.  These are generated by examining a table's column types and finding
 out if there are any ColumnConstraints that support that type.  If so, a ColumnFilterData is
 created for that column which then allows filtering on that columns data.
